info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN TRANSYLVANIA...CENTRAL HENDERSON...SOUTHWESTERN POLK...NORTHWESTERN GREENVILLE AND NORTH CENTRAL PICKENS COUNTIES UNTIL 345 AM EDT... At 315 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm 7 miles south of Brevard, or 4 miles northwest of Caesars Head State Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Hendersonville, Brevard, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Rosman, Jones Gap State Park and Dupont State Forest. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
